website_summaries.verdict: Considering the security, automatic data backup feature, and amount of storage available for your buck, the Canvio Advance is a worthy option.
pros: Downloadable auto backup and security software
Good value for the storage space
cons: Mac owners will need to reformat this drive

customer_reviews.title: Great for my MacBook.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to backup my MacBook. The description didn't say much about being used as a backup for Macs, but I decided to purchase it anyways. I plugged it in and the MacBook automatically formatted it and started the backup process. I am very impressed how fast it backed up my computer. It's also nice and small.
customer_reviews.author: Jutsinger

customer_reviews.title: Backup Software file format is TERRIBLE !!!!
customer_reviews.text: The Back Up software that is include it horrible. The bup file format is .bkup You cant confirm what you backed up until you need to restore and then it may be too late. We need a BackUp software that does a straight copy, the same as if files were drag and dropped, instead of backup to files formatted to be only opened by that particular backup software. I want to see files that end in .pdf .xls . png ,jpg not .bkup. I want to see WORD and excel files --- not .bkup
customer_reviews.author: LDO

customer_reviews.title: not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I started with back up, two days and then you cant access the files, then I had to erase it took 5 min to delete two days. Now I am adding a folder one by one. My hard drive is only 500 gig. Now I get errors saying Window no space, this has nothing to do and says out of space. I am sending this back. Called tech support, stupid. I also formatted the whole drive just a copy and paste, same error message, Now My computer had 500 gig and I am only copying photos and doc maybe 30 gig and it wont even take this amount. Something wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Chevymom53

customer_reviews.title: Fine Hard Drive -- Beware Cable Going Bad
customer_reviews.text: The hard drive itself works as advertised, HOWEVER the cable went bad after 9 months and made me think the whole drive was bad. I'd plug in the drive and the light would turn on and I could feel it spin up, but it would never mount on my computers (OS X, Linux, and Windows). I thought it was a defective drive and was pretty dismayed based on the warranty problems other people had. Luckily I had another cable laying around and figured I'd give a shot and it worked! If you're having problems with the drive, try another cable before throwing it in the trash can like I almost did!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D

customer_reviews.title: WARNING-Only backs up 1 device!
customer_reviews.text: When I saw this on Amazon, compared it to other backup/storage devices, read the reviews and for the price, I bought it. NONE of the reviews I read stated that this device will backup only ONE computer. My previous backup device, Click-Free, backed up all 3 of my computers plus two iPhones with no problems. This Toshiba backup device recognizes ONLY ONE COMPUTER! If you try to backup a second, it will overwrite the backup of the first computer! Ridiculous for a backup device to recognize only one computer to back up. It's going back!
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: READ ME... IMPORTANT!!!! WTF
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on 1/3/19, dies on 11/26/19. Trying to recover the data from the disk and am partially successful. HOWEVER... I did not but a refurbished drive, it was supposed to be new. I am finding files and data from three previous users, going back as far as February 2004!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: Portable and works well
customer_reviews.text: Works great out of the box. I transferred almost 1tb of data without issue. It took forever but it got the job done. The blue color looks nice too. My only issue with this was the amount of scratches already on it upon unboxing this thing. The bottom and sides are more of a matted look. But the top surface is glossy. Probably why it was scratched up while they packaged it. I sure hope this was a new item. Other than all the scratches, I thought it preformed great out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: mrdaoyang

customer_reviews.title: the cable will not stay attached
customer_reviews.text: I have to reconnect the cable on this numerous times all day. I am terrified to even slightly move my laptop because every time I do it says the drive has been disconnected improperly. it's SO annoying. Drive works fine but literally if you have a stationary tower computer than you can put this on it but if you so much as move your laptop one inch it will disconnect. drives me crazy
customer_reviews.author: HumanBeing0101

customer_reviews.title: After 9 months of using, I no longer can access the files
customer_reviews.text: All of my files are unaccessable. I am a graphic designer and I Have lost my whole livelihood. All of my designs and files are GONE.. I cannot access them... I tried multiple computers and different cords to make sure. I am SO disappointed and furious. I thought I was buying a good product with a good company. I do NOT suggest of buying this product until they resolve the issues that they are having with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great harddrive!
customer_reviews.text: I would like to start by saying I use hardrives for my storages for photos. I currently own many brands from Seagate, WD and these Toshiba. So far out of all of them Toshiba have kept up with the manufacturer specs for download and upload transfer rates. Over all wonderfully harddrive to use and keep for many purposes.
customer_reviews.author: benji

customer_reviews.title: Internal Connector failed after 10 unplugs
customer_reviews.text: This product is a piece of junk. The internal connector failed after plugging and unplugging it only about 10 times. I expected so much better from Toshiba but what a disappointment. Then I called to get warranty service and they tell me "sometime the connector is not covered under warranty". What??? Are you kidding me??? What good is a warranty that is a lie? Will never buy Toshiba again . . .
customer_reviews.author: D. W.

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Bought this and it failed me. It crashed every time I tried to setup a backup plan.. So I contacted Amazon Technical Support. Instead of telling me how to fix it, they put in for a replacement. Unfortunately, the replacement was not working and was doing the same thing as the first one. I don’t recommend this hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gwin

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly and difficult to use.
customer_reviews.text: Not user friendly at all even after downloading the updated drivers for it. it is difficult to transfer files from your computer to this device. dragging and dropping files is not possible with this drive. when you are using it you can not tell or see what you are doing and have no idea if trasferring files are even working.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: small, portable, light, lots of room for files at a decent price
customer_reviews.text: Smaller then i had imagined. There are 2 softwares to download for it depending on what you want to use the device for. One is regular and the other is secured/encrypted. Those get a bit confusing if you're not too tech savvy and that would be the only thing where it would lose points in my book. Or you can just use the old copy/paste or drag & drop method to put your files on the drive to keep them from accidental deletion for which you don't need the software because it's ready-to-use for this method. Small portable drive, 2 TB space. very nice and very portable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superior Hard drives
customer_reviews.text: I went with Toshiba after loosing 4 of 5 Seagate harddrives to poor quality! Do not buy Seagate products: They're cheaply made using low quality components. This Toshiba drive is not only better made, its speed is superior to any drive I own (Seagate). Its fast, small, and very well made. I have several older Toshiba drives that are also working perfectly. I'll never go any other way but Toshiba for my memory drive requirements.
customer_reviews.author: Wilbur

customer_reviews.title: Two-days old, loaded with backups, now can't access, no customer svc available...
customer_reviews.text: I suppose it's what I get for trying Toshiba. Their security SW is total GARBAGE. Now the drive can't be seen, reports error: "cannot execute this software because the required service program has not been started," when you try to access the drive by opening the security program. When you try to start the security program on your main system, you get the SAME ERROR!!! So..., the drive is secure alright. So secure no one will ever be able to access ANYTHING on it again! Seagate??
customer_reviews.author: TRJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for backing up your computer
customer_reviews.text: Perfect to back up my photos, music and documents. I have over 20,000 photos, about 5,000 songs and quite a bit of word, excel and PDF documents. This is light and portable. Very fast transfer and I still have quite a bit of room to keep adding. If you’re not backing up your computer, you MUST do it!! My computer just got the black screen of death but I’m not too upset because everything is backed up on my Toshiba portable usb driver.
customer_reviews.author: PixiesMommy2018

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 months, warranty doesn't include replacement
customer_reviews.text: This drive lasted me about two months. It was still under warranty so I called Toshiba to get a replacement. Unbelievably, they don't replace them! Instead, they will send you a prepaid Visa card "for some amount" which does not include the sales tax you paid. Of course, I have to send the original unit back to them at my own expense. Why not just send me a new one in exchange for the bad one? Oh well, they can be sure I won't spend whatever money they send me on another Toshiba. Edit: I complained about Toshiba's business practices to Amazon and to their credit Amazon refunded my sales tax. I will avoid buying Toshiba products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: SomeGuy

customer_reviews.title: Mixed emotions
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a bit clunkier and noisier and vibrates more than I would like. I now have three such drives... a WD USB 2.0 320GB from 11 years ago... a Toshiba USB 3.0 1TB from 7 years ago... and this new Toshiba USB 3.0 4TB. The old ones are quieter.. vibrate less when spinning... they have rubber feet... this new new does not which enhances its noise when sitting on the desktop. I put it on a cork drink coaster to quiet it. The case is a little thick and has square edges compared to most others including my old drives... just not as sleek. I hope the extra vibration doesn't mean an early failure. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Guy

customer_reviews.title: Used as an external drive for PS4
customer_reviews.text: My Playstation 4 was running out of space, so I purchased this. Setup was extremely simple - all I had to do was plug the USB cable into my console, and I could instantly transfer games and other media to it from the console, without any trouble or even the need to search for setup instructions online.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with PS4
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to hook up to my PS4 but it doesn't recognize the drive. My PS4 is a 1st generation from when they initially came out. Not sure if that has to do with anything. I hook it up to the drive and it doesn't see it however if I connect it to a computer, it reads it just fine. I only bought it for the game console and the Q and A questions said it's supposed to work but it doesn't. I missed the window to return the drive so now I'm stuck with it. Playstation's website says that PS4 is now compatible with a Seagate version? Yeah another 80 bucks to scrape up.
customer_reviews.author: HappyCow

customer_reviews.title: It no longer works
customer_reviews.text: It worked great ... until while working today, it just up & became unreadable. I have 3 different Virus protection programs so it wasn't that as each scan said the product had no issues .... how a device could just up and die like this is unbelieveable. Now I have work that I haven't had a chance to upload to the cloud lost forever. I'm going back to the smaller USB jump drives .... Oh & yes, there was more than enough room left on the device.
customer_reviews.author: WildThing

customer_reviews.title: Connects and disconnects
customer_reviews.text: Very quirky, very often it just powers on and off over and over again. I've tried different cables and different computers. My WD wasn't like that, so I'll be returning this one.
customer_reviews.author: cl

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Toshiba 2TB external hard drive I have purchased. The first lasted about 6 months. I contacted Toshiba and returned it under warranty. I assumed it was a fluke, and because I liked the size of the drive I bought another. This second drive failed in 10 days. I'm not sure what the issue is, but I'm not interested in trying a third. Sadly, the requirements for returning the product under warranty are far more stringent that how it was shipped to me, and a refund takes up to 6 weeks. I'm still waiting for the refund on the first drive. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: McLJ

customer_reviews.title: System won't restart with drive connected
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these and use them with Windows 10 pro. The y work to store and retrieve data. However, if I try a Windows restart for the computer, the system hangs up. If I use physical on/off, the system seems eventually to boot up. Both drives have a similar performance issue. I tried them on a second computer by a different manufactuer, and get the same response. If I remove the drive the system them works fine. Tech support does not respond.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy for current gen gaming consoles
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my xbox to upgrade the storage based on several reviews. Noticed right away that games that run off this drive take a pretty sizable hit to image quality, loads slower, and corrupts the games being transferred from the external drive to the consoles internal, so you have to remember to pick the correct drive each time you want to download something depending on if you want the game to be visually appealing. Prolly will end up using it as a secondary document/picture backup as it seems to be outdated hardware for the current console generation
customer_reviews.author: The Grim Reverend Steven Rage

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It works as promised. I comes with the ability to add included software that will enable the hard drive to automatically back up your files, etc. I don't plan to use that because I like to have more control over my backups. I also plan to keep it plugged in to my computer as the default hard drive to which files are saved. My computer now has a solid state hard drive with 500gb, which is plenty to hold all of my programs. All data, files, pictures, music, etc, will be stored on my Toshiba hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Super portable
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than expected, super portable, lightweight yet solid. Improvable: would be ideal if the security software allow us to place a message to warn that the drive is password protected so that whoever finds it can return to this or that email or number.
customer_reviews.author: JPRiquezes

customer_reviews.title: Shiny HIGH gloss drive
customer_reviews.text: I've owned many external hard drives, nearly every one has failed, except the half dozen Toshiba drives I've owned. Other brands have failed internally, others through mishaps or rough handling, my bad, but not Toshibas, ever, the only brand for me. I'm leaving a review though to say that I was surprised to find this red drive has a beautiful, polished dark-ish candy apple red finish. I couldn't tell from the photos that it has a high gloss finish, much preferred to boring matte drives, love it. Ultra-fast, too, perfect. Highest recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Trancelucence

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I've had this unit plugged into my computer for five months as a daily automatic backup drive using Acronis True Image software (purchased separately). The drive has worked flawlessly so far. It does not heat up and there is no noticeable hum or other noise. I thought the unit was impressive at 4TB in such a small form factor for under $100. No cons so far. I've always been happy with Toshiba products and this one did not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: SLS-LDS

customer_reviews.title: A steal
customer_reviews.text: The fact there's a 4TB drive that actually does not have a history of design and/or manufacturing problems is the biggest plus. The fact that its a drive plus enclosure plus a real USB port for less than a bare 2.5" 4TB "reconditioned" hard drive is a super good deal. Used as a 3-partition drive on a Mac; clone, Time Machine and Open Space. Hasn't skipped a beat. Will likely buy another.
customer_reviews.author: RaytoTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Slowed to a halt - read / write super slow
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what the issue is. Have done enough to get it working but the product read / write speed just slowed unreasonably. I would avoid this product. Too many bad reviews.
customer_reviews.author: JelloManJohnny

customer_reviews.title: SOLID BUY
customer_reviews.text: I use this for all my storage needs since my PC onlyhas a 240GB hard drive. I have had absolutely no issues with this at all! I’ve installed about 10 games on it and also store huge media and program files to it and haven’t even broke 3/4’s of it yet. I have yet to sense it over heat, even after playing games installed directly to it for a few hours. Applications/Programs/Games/media...whatever storage needs you have. This will do just fine. Just keep in mind the GB size and Taylor to your needs.1TB suits me perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Bad experience
customer_reviews.text: Until now I had a lot of very good experiences with External Hard Drives from various producers not so known as Toshiba. This time I decided to buy 2 drives from the reputable company Toshiba. The first drive stopped working after downloading 140 GB and after formatting, no data was not possible to download. The second drive works very slowly and I am afraid that it will follow the first drive.
customer_reviews.author: Vaclav

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: The drive initially failed a mere 2 months after I began to use it. I thought it might have been some type of file structure/directory error, so I reformatted it and began using it again. Big mistake. After about 2.5 TB of data was stored on it, mainly Final Cut Pro X libraries and footage. It appeared to be working ok until this morning and it suddenly disconnected and wouldn't remount. I tried Disk First Aid and it wouldn't do anything. I tried Disk Drill Media Recovery for $39 on the Mac App Store and it managed to recover nearly everything off of the drive. Would I recommend this drive? Hell no!
customer_reviews.author: Ron Flaviano

customer_reviews.title: Bought for expanded storage for my PS4
customer_reviews.text: I bought this harddrive to expand the storage on my Playstation 4 (PS4). It does exactly what you would expect! I plugged the hard drive in, the PS4 recognized it and asked if I wanted to format (of course you have to say yes), and then it was up and running. I now have about 5 games saved solely on the hard drive, and they load just as fast as if they were on the internal. I don't plan to every take this hard drive with me since it was meant for the PS4, but it is very small. I would say it compares well to a deck of cards, except a bit thinner. Very pleased overall.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: Fatal Design Flaw - expect it to fail
customer_reviews.text: Sudden death - it turns out that the device has a voltage overload protection module that is triggered by voltage excess (don't know amount of excess is the trigger) and then the module renders the device safe by detaching power. Once that takes place no option exists to power on external hard drive. While data may be ssfe, it is safe inside a box and you can not possibly access it and I mean forever. I'm guessing if you have a recovery expert do the job they can open it up and maybe use the drive to copy and recover your data. Do not entrust critical data to this device. Protect it from power excesses. Expect it to fail.
customer_reviews.author: Doc C

customer_reviews.title: Surprising Good
customer_reviews.text: Have been a WD fan for over 20 years. Due to the good User Reviews and badly failure of my last 2-years old WD, I'm trying this Toshiba. Just got it today and surprised to find out it is thinner and lighter than my WD Password Ultra and WD Passport. Both WD and Toshiba perform similar but WD's security user interface is better and easier (can skip password). Anyway, will test this Toshiba for a couple of months. If is works well, will switch my heard to Toshiba as it is lighter so better for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Great: Bought Two! Can't figure out security feature . . . yet.
customer_reviews.text: These little guys are great. They are super quiet and do the job. On my Mac, you can easily drag/drop files from your internal hard drive or another external drive to the other. I keep a 1TB for travel and daily use. My 2TB is for backing up my first drive and my desktop Mac. I have lots of family photos and videos I never want to lose! Great investment. Format it for Max using the free Tuxera Disk Manager software. However, I have not figured out how to set a password or secure it. So Toshiba, if you're reading, how do you do that on a Mac. (The security software is for Windows.)
customer_reviews.author: P.W.A.

customer_reviews.title: It's lightweight.  4TB is a resonalble amount. It's inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: Just plugged it in. It's working. Now that's a good start. If anything changes, you'll be the first to know. Speeds are typical for an external USB 3.0 drive. About 110MB/sec transferring from an SolidStateDrive to this HardDiskDrive. As a warning (suggestion?) don't ever put any critical (to you) data on only ONE Hard Disk Drive or Solid State Drive - unless it's not that critical to you. RAID 10 is nice but pricey.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyCapsTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works as needed, satisfied with purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I only gave tech support a 3 star rating because I haven't needed to use it. I bought this for school as an animation student. Works well for what I need it for, which is storing classwork and projects since I work on them on multiple computers. Haven't had any issues, and it's password protected just in case it gets lost or stolen. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Monika

customer_reviews.title: Bad product, terrible customer support
customer_reviews.text: This product backed up my hard drive exactly once. Then it quit. To fix the problem, Customer support wants to charge me over half what I paid originally. I don’t intend to throw good money after bad, nor to return the thing after seeing I’d have to pay close to what I originally paid in shipping ( more than that in aggravation). You got me, Toshiba. I am giving this device two stars because I’m still using it to store files manually. Hope that doesn’t quit, too.in any case, once bitten, twice shy. I’ll no longer buy this company’s products.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Wiseman

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Like the white one.. Matches my wii. Was a good deal. I left it formatted NTSC, and works great for the wii. Only problem is the hard drive does go to sleep after a while. I noticed that when downloading covers for my games... I have to dl them one by one because the wii does freeze afte a while (prob cuz the hdd isn't being accessed) Seems to work ok tho so far. I take 1 star away cuz it goes to sleep... Maybe I'm being harsh...
customer_reviews.author: dude

customer_reviews.title: Lots of memory easy to use so far so good. Xbox one and Halo edition Xbox
customer_reviews.text: Lots of memory lots of games and more left after 44 large games moved to drive I still have all my internal memory and 1.7 to left on driveTurns on off with Xbox one. In settings power mode turn off quick auto on for Xbox to have drive turn off with Xbox and on, yes it's not instant on takes longer to boot Xbox on but otherwise drive will stay on . * Bought a second one after trying out for 2 months for other Xbox, it also works fine for now.
customer_reviews.author: WorkinghardlovingProudMomof2

customer_reviews.title: LOOKS GOOD BUT...
customer_reviews.text: i bought this external hard drive to replace another that was starting to malfunction after about two years of use. The old drive had the effect of increasing the boot time when I started my computer. Also, the drive would keep disconnecting and then reconnecting to my system. This new drive started doing the same thing right out of the box. In addition it was making whirring noises that my other external drive does not. I felt that those actions indicated that the drive was defective so I had to return it for a refund. This was my first Toshiba drive. It may be my last.
customer_reviews.author: J. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this (in red) towards the end on January for some classes that required us to download large files. I read the 1 star reviews and hoped that I wouldn't be one of the unlucky ones. With my luck, the hard drive decided to die mid-April on a morning consisting of 2 exams... along with all of my notes. What is the point of purchasing something than can't even last a semester? Why should we have to be paranoid about losing our data? Getting a better product for a few more bucks is better than the frustration of dealing with a waste of 50 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Salena

customer_reviews.title: Not What It Seems.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for almost a year. The connector cable came off and now it disconnects from the hard drive all the time. AND now it seems my computers are having a hard time recognizing the drive. Lots of space to backup, but if it doesn’t last, then what? I back up my work files daily so it’s extremely important that I have a good functioning hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: R&B90

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 5 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drive for my PS4 and only play a couple times a week due to work schedule. It sat in one spot, unmoved, in a well-ventilated area. I went to play last night and the drive was making a grinding noise when it started up and did not work anymore. Of course, when I logged in to Amazon, it said it is past the return date...by 1 week.. Luckily I was only using this for a game system and not for business critical backup. The price was good at $60, but not when it only lasts for a month of very light use.
customer_reviews.author: Damion

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and to use
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved Toshiba laptop and feel in love with their external hard drives products as well. The only one issue it you have to download the security software from an unsecured website. I wish Toshiba would make their Had drivesupport website secure, so people like me wouldn't overthink and not do it. Because paranoid about viruses, ransomware affecting the computer. Maybe start having the drive come pre-installed with the software as other brands do. That would be greatly beneficial.

customer_reviews.title: A WASTE OF MONEY.
customer_reviews.text: A WASTE OF MONEY . I purchased 2 of these and both are worthless. Not reading on any computers. I want my monies back Amazon. Read my other extensive review attached to the other drive. waste of money, waste of money, waste of money. Worthless product. Every time I try to get it to work and it does not I say I will post reviews but do not. I tried for the hundredth time just now same thing. It's not reading no matter what I do just lighting up vibrating and cutting off. Toshiba u have become a ripoff.
customer_reviews.author: S.fred

customer_reviews.title: You must reformat for Mac
customer_reviews.text: You must reformat for Mac. You can google it or here: How to Format an External Drive in OS X Connect the drive to the Mac. Open Disk Utility. ... Select the drive you want to format. Click Erase. Give the drive a descriptive name and leave the default settings: OS X Extended format and GUID partition map. ... Click Erase and OS X will format the drive. Part of me is annoyed because I ordered it thinking it was Mac compatible just to find out sure it is once reformatted. 🤐
customer_reviews.author: Zeta Angel

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I've had many external drives over the years and this is the first one that died. I have other Toshiba and Seagate drives that are well over 5 and 10 years old and still working while this one is only 13 months. It lights up but is not recognized and I can feel a little click when I'm holding it.
customer_reviews.author: vt

customer_reviews.title: Forced Restart To Get The Hard Drive To Eject / Disconnect
customer_reviews.text: Have had the item for over a month now. It works fine in part, easy to configure and transfer data. However, there’s a regular issue with ejecting and/or shutting down the external hard drive when done using it. This happens when using on either laptops (Windows or Mac). I have to restart each laptop for the device to eject properly. For this reason I give it 2 stars. It’s more of a hassle to use it if you have to restart your computer each and every time. For this reason I would not buy again and I’m going to look at a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: D Genovese

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I've had this only a few weeks and normally I'd wait to write a review but to be honest I've had several Toshiba portable drives over many years and not even one of them has failed. I use them for Time Machine backups, cloned backups, and portable storage--mostly for transferring large files from one computer/drive to another and none of the drives have ever failed. I don't use them with any software provided for backups as I have my own applications but for everything I know about--5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: RobinGBTop Contributor: Karaoke

customer_reviews.title: Great drive
customer_reviews.text: I have had good luck with Toshiba drives and use them extensively. I use this one for backing up my laptop/PC and it works as expected. I do NOT use the Toshiba software or any other backup software, I simply copy the directories and files to the disk manually as needed. That method has always worked fine for me and I prefer it. Will update if I run into any issues, but so far, so good. I find the Toshiba drives to be reliable and an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Bron

customer_reviews.title: Read if you use this with a mac
customer_reviews.text: Anyone using this for a mac will need to reformat it with the APFS file system to get high read and write speeds. People were complaining they get bad write speeds on mac because they have EXT4 or FAT32 file systems on it. I use this with my mac to back things up and get high write speeds on correct file system - the apple file system (APFS). Use disk utility to format.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie H.

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this if you want to save your Data
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in March of last year, and suddenly it won't mount. I use it as a back up drive for my Mac using Time Machine, and now I have no backup. I will never purchase another Toshiba drive. The WD drives that I've had over the years just keep on going and going. This Toshiba just gave up the ghost for no reason and nothing I do will bring it back to life. Glad it was only my backup, which I can re-create, and not something that was irreplaceable. STAY AWAY
customer_reviews.author: Marty S

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! Discontinued by manufacturer. Crashed my computer.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY. has been discontinued by the manufacture, and they no longer provide tech-support.CRASHED MY COMPUTER! Lost all my software, except for operating system. I threw the darn thing in the garbage. It was a pain in the you know what from the day I got it. Again, do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Laura G.

customer_reviews.title: Fast and plenty of space
customer_reviews.text: Great high capacity storage that is backwards compatible with USB 2.0. Can be formatted to your needs. I've used one for a computer and have also used one for extended gaming console memory and work great for both. Never needed to deal with tech support and the drive is plug and play. I'd recommend this drive for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have only added pictures from my MacBook Pro and Dell Computer and it has worked very smoothly and easily. Uploading the pictures from the external drive does not take long at all and I have over 9500 pics and videos on it so far. However, I do wish it could take pics and videos from the device faster and put it onto the external drive but during this quarantine time I have nothing else to do so I'm ok with it not being super fast.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I had this piece of garbage for a whopping 6 months before it turned into a brick and lost all my data. As a small business owner, losing your back-up data really stinks. After calling Toshiba's customer "support," they informed me that though they warranty the brick, I mean defective hardware, they don't do a thing about the data on it. That's your bill to cover. Oh and to ship back the defective product, you get to pay for shipping too! BUY A SEAGATE! What a lousy experience.
customer_reviews.author: John Richelsen

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth It
customer_reviews.text: First let me say that I've purchased 3 external hard drives from Samsung through here. I'm not sure if one of the sellers is selling knockoff fake products or if Samsung has taken a recent drive but, the very first one I have still works great. Both of the other two have died This one I just bough 8 months ago and it's already failing. Lost countless value I'd saved on them and not to mention the cost of the drives themselves. Save yourself the trouble. Don't Buy These!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer W.

customer_reviews.title: So far, mostly good...
customer_reviews.text: I like this little external HDD. it is a nice design, the blue LED is cool. Seems to take a second or two to spin up. Otherwise file transfer and retrieval are uneventful. However, I did loose a file and something locked up shortly after moving loads of folders over. Not sure why, hasn't happened again. Have not experimented with the backup software either. I want to like this, but so far have no replaced an older WD external HDD. Waiting to see if any other issues crop up.
customer_reviews.author: DaveCarrera4

customer_reviews.title: Seems Reliable & Nice Size
customer_reviews.text: I use it as an external drive for videos through my PS4. Works great. I use MP4 videos that I load through MacBook Air. Then I plug it into PS4. They have the be encoded to particular specifications and the drive needs to have a couple folders that need to be done (Google it) but it works beautifully. Who knows how long it will last. I’m highly skeptical of the reliability of any external drive but after a couple months I’ve not seen any hints of problems. I’ll update this review if it ever fails on me but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Of Los Angeles

customer_reviews.title: Great backup drive
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing so far. The 4TB capacity is more than enough to backup all my files. My initial backup was about 1.5 TBs and it went by super fast (I should have timed it but is was less than 20 minutes) which is much faster than my older drive. The case is small but sturdy and there's a nice obvious blue LED that lets you know its busy (I have an earlier backup drive I used with a barely visible activity LED that annoyed the heck out of me). Very happy and a great Prime Day deal.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Case

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This item works perfect!! I transferred approx. 200GB of data and it took about an hour to write all the files to the hard drive. This drive is very fast, especially with the USB 3.0. I am so happy that I bought this item. I used a $20 256gb flash drive before using this item and it produced corrupted files and error messages. However, with this hard drive I experienced no problems at all. I highly recommend this item if you are looking for an external hard drive. Note: The toshiba backup software sucks so I just used copy and paste.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Herring

customer_reviews.title: Months old - stopped working - Cable and connector defective
customer_reviews.text: I just finished a huge edit of photos, working on the external drive, when it stopped working. After replugging the connector a few times, I pushed it in really hard and it finally worked. I used the time to copy everything off and it stopped working again. It's 2 weeks past the return period. This feels flimsy and both of them have had intermittent problems. One doesn't work at all with it's cable and I have to use the 2nd one, but only if really pushed in (which you shouldn't have to do). To save us from potential heartbreak we are throwing these out. And yes, fortunately I made backups.
customer_reviews.author: Karen A. Hickey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little drive for an excellent price
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive does everything it says it will. Bought the 2TB version. Install was a breeze, just hook it up via the included USB cable and it's good to go. I was surprised by the quicker than expected transfer through USB 3.1, which allowed me to backup 800GB of data pretty quick. Will update if any problems occur, but so far, smooth sailing. Update 3/1/2019 : After 2 months, drive is still working well with no problems. It's about 50% full and transfers quick.
customer_reviews.author: Aron

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. I have external hard drives that have to be plugged into electricity and wanted something more portable. I left my old files on one of the old hard drives but copied them over to a new one also. I bought a 4 TB for all of our files and a 2 TB for my Genealogy records. I have happy with both of them. I'm glad they come in different colors so I could buy different colors and see which one I want at a glance. Very happy with both of them.
customer_reviews.author: Judy M.

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba SSD external drive
customer_reviews.text: This Item for the wife . Being a teacher has lead to a great deal of files that have been generated. Since March being A High School Science teacher and teaching different subject of science. She need a good deal of storage, The cost difference between It and 1TB and the 2TB was so low I went with the I went with the 2TB. I Have uses Toshiba drive in the past and hand on problems with them. so far she has had on problems .
customer_reviews.author: Joseph L. Chastain

customer_reviews.title: Does not work!
customer_reviews.text: I did (2) back ups of EVERYTHING (just to be sure). Two days later I needed to restore my Desktop. It showed that it was backed up AND AVAILABLE. so I restoored it. Nothing changed. A couple days later I tried it again - AGAIN, THE RESTORE SAID IT WAS SUCCESSFUL, BUT NOTHING CHANGED. CALLED TOSHUBA - BANKS HAVE BETTER CUSTOMER FRIENDLY HOURS (TECH SUPPORT) - ONLY M-F FOR TOSHIBA. WISH ME LUCK. PROBABLY HAVE TO RETURN. THE SOFTWARE IS PRETTY SIMPLE STUPID - REALLY NO ROOM FOR OPERATOR ERROR. IT IS PRETY FAST.
customer_reviews.author: CMP3

customer_reviews.title: nice design, poor software
customer_reviews.text: design is nice, packaging is nice, it get's the job done. but softwares are poor. Backup is not working at all. You pick the folders then wait for 30 minutes untill the backup process is completed then... nothing! no any new files added. just not working! also if you put the password and then forgot... say goodbye to your HD. One time I almost forgot, couldn't do anything until I got the right pass thanks God..... so be careful. just use it in simple way..
customer_reviews.author: Hrach Hovhannisyan

customer_reviews.title: Painful to use
customer_reviews.text: First you must go to their website and down load the software to make a back-up of your computer. After doing so it worked once then each time after I have had to go back and down load the software again. Now the software won't work at all after only 3 back-ups and still have 1.6 TB left on the drive. Just try to reach their support group...good luck with that. I would not recommend this drive to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Coug 123

customer_reviews.title: Bigger capacity for nearly all your needs
customer_reviews.text: Amazing capacity. I loaded some hi def movies on it and was surprised bysuch a tiny sliver of used capacity. Will ake some 20 to 30 minutes to transfer 12gb files. I've had portable drives before but this one has such a higher aesthetic. Looks like shiny glass on both sides as well a a clean looking "working light" in the form of a circle. I'll definitely try this Toshiba brand again. I wasnt too satisfied with a WD My Passport that made itself look like it was writing error free data.
customer_reviews.author: L11

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my Macbook Pro!
customer_reviews.text: When I first plugged it in, I couldn't add files to it. I simply went into Applications - Utilities - Disk Utility and erased using Mac OS Extended (Journaled). Works perfectly. I just drag my files to the Toshiba. No issue so far.
customer_reviews.author: NDS

customer_reviews.title: Nightmares are real
customer_reviews.text: Worst purchase ever... DO NOT BUY under any circumstances.. feb 16 .. little over a month since purchase. Drive which had my school wrk 3 years worth and 5 years of financial work for my office lost because drive gave out... this is a waste of my money..... .. drive stops reading on my pc... tv.... laptop and IT technician told me it was poorly made... what am i to do?? Disgruntled ....upset.... morbidly dissatisfied AGAIN DO NOT BUY IF YOUR DATA IS VALUABLE...
customer_reviews.author: jason barnes

customer_reviews.title: Quit with no warning after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 2 years and 3 days. It was never misused or dropped. I have a similar model that is over 4 years old so I am a little disappointed. Thank goodness it was only used for Xbox games or I would have lost everything with no notice.
customer_reviews.author: MelissaC

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 2 months, corrupting 2TB of my work data. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I got this on sale to use for my Audible recordings. Things were going well. I could record on the go and save directly to the harddrive. I have most files backed up on my desktop at home, but when a deadline is close - I generally bring the external to get work done on the road. Tonight, after 6 hours of editing - it begins to click. I have read that this is the "Toshiba click of death" and I now know why this product was on sale. It is useless now.
customer_reviews.author: Shan

customer_reviews.title: Large storage capacity, but slow
customer_reviews.text: The size, look and feel of the drive is excellent. Small and portable. 2TB of storage at a great price. I use it for my Time Machine and I'm surprised it's that slow. I expected it to be faster. I might get a usbc cable to see if that improves speed.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando

customer_reviews.title: Junk or knockoff?
customer_reviews.text: i only use Toshiba drives. i own 3 others. Not sure if this model is a knock off or just a piece of junk. Drive does not work. wont let me put anything on it. I knew when it came in the mail it was not like the other Toshiba drives i have purchased. Feels lighter, kinda rinky dink and very noisy. Lots of clicking and whirring. My other drives are silent and feel like a better quality. I recommend staying away from this one. I am about to send it back and will give details on how the seller handles the situation.
customer_reviews.author: william d sadler

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: First there is no software for it so you have to dig through the internet to find it, then you will add items to it- find that they are no longer there later and it will start making crazy loud noises like a clicking sound and disappear. Waste of money!! I am not new at this I have had multiple external storage drives and this one by far is the worst. Stick with WD or any other brand but this one.
customer_reviews.author: Photogal

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba Canvio Advance 4TB Portable External Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: Have had this HD for 4 months so, can't speak for longevity but, this is my 4rth Toshiba portable HD over a 7 year period. 3- 4tb and 1-1.5tb and haven't had an issue with any of them. I would expect this one will be no different.. All of my drives run 24-7 with no breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Ted F.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 8 months.
customer_reviews.text: This was used to back up a small set of files daily, four days a week. Failed after 8 months use. No longer recognized by the computer, so impossible to do a disk check or format. Similar drive works fine. And good luck with the Toshiba support site. One hyperlink to get an RMA is invalid. When you do find the correct RMA site and fill out your information about the product, clicking "Continue" takes you right back to the beginning of the process. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Doug1Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Died within two months of light use.
customer_reviews.text: I've had several portable HD's over the years, but this is the first one I consider to have been junk. Worked fine, then all of a sudden it started having flaky connection issues. Then it died altogether and won't even power on. Less than two months of light use as a backup device.
customer_reviews.author: James Flippin

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: Says software is downloadable from the website, but is not there. Also, bought this during Covid-19 since I have extra time to do things like back up my files. The day after I ran this on my laptop it died completely and will not turn on. The laptop is less than 6 months old.. not sure that is a coincidence. No previous problems.
customer_reviews.author: melissa wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Lost all my data
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for 1 month. After that it started disconnecting and reconnecting - just like other people said. I got a new cord and still didn't work. I finally got it to connect by pushing the cord in as hard as i could and i immediately started recopying my stuff back to my my hard drive then my dog bumped it with her foot and it disconnected again. Tried the amazon tech support and it was painful and very unhelpful. I'm going to keep trying to get my data off and then I am sending it back and getting a WD.
customer_reviews.author: LeeAnna

customer_reviews.title: Storage Capacity
customer_reviews.text: I love that this portable drive holds 4 Terabytes. I take a lot of photos and need reliable and large capacity in a storage unit and this one fills the need. I have found that the Toshiba brand of hard drives is more reliable and our lasts other brands. This is my second Toshiba and my fourth overall portable hard drive. I have not used technical support therefore I did not review that feature.
customer_reviews.author: M. Conant

customer_reviews.title: Super, high-capacity drive that works reliably.  Moderately priced.
customer_reviews.text: I have transferred over 2.2 TB of data to this 3 TB drive. It has a fast USB 3.0 interface and works extremely reliably. Great for storing images of the whole machine (I use Acronis) that would enable reliable recovery and restoration to a new computer in the event of a total disaster or loss/theft of the computer. For daily backup of critical files and directories, it's just great.
customer_reviews.author: Umesh Mathur

customer_reviews.title: Get the red one.
customer_reviews.text: Everyone knows that it goes faster if you paint it red. More seriously, it's a great value. Compared to some more tank-y prices, the Canvio is not the most portable from a durability standpoint; but, if you're careful packing and unpacking it, there's no real reason to worry. Besides, you always backup critical data, right?
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: This product has been a lifesaver. I have been able to save so much on this portable drive. Pictures, documents, and other things I wanted to backup from my laptop. And I still have space to spare. It has been so easy to use, install, and travel with when needed. I would recommend to anyone who needs to save space on their PC or needs a drive to backup information.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, stable and fast!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a backup drive. I don't transport it so I can't speak to that. It's the least expensive name-brand drive I've seen, offering 2 TB. It's much faster than traditional HDD's, runs cool during backups, but mostly sits idle since I only backup a few times a day. I have online backup but like to keep "hard copies" of all my files as well. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Dad

customer_reviews.title: Loses Folders/Files
customer_reviews.text: Thankfully I only had copies of photos in the folders it lost. Use it to back stuff up.. but it's not really reliable. I had a folder with photos I meant to print and when I plugged into my home laptop that folder was gone. It would come up in the search at first but couldn't open. Then it stopped coming up in the search. Would go with another brand. It's also slow on moving files into/out of/ around within.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my Dish Network Hopper DVR
customer_reviews.text: Was $40 when I bought it and worked perfectly with my Dish Network DVR. I don't know why I didn't get one sooner! Note that it takes a LONG time to download all your movies. This isn't a criticism just information. I had about 300 GB and it took all night and part of the next morning.
customer_reviews.author: Gambler

customer_reviews.title: This deserves ZERO stars!!!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED REVIEW (08/14/20): I returned this device back in MARCH of this year. It is now THE MIDDLE OF AUGUST and I still have yet to receive my refund! They keep blowing smoke up my ass saying that "they're trying to find a new company to make the rewards cards." Absolute bull! It's a SCAM. DO NOT PURCHASE ANYTHING FROM TOSHIBA. ORIGINAL REVIEW: Storage is fine, but we can never eject it safely except for shutting the computer down. Even when it is running, we have to restart the computer to access certain folders about one out of five times. Our last Toshiba HDD is great, so we were pretty disappointed we didn’t return this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: ZachsAllRed

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. Bought it March 14th. Today is April 12th. I had 1tb full on this thing then it deleted half of my files. Had to try to save the missing files and repaired it. That lasted about 10 minutes. Repaired and restored files then stopped working altogether. Absolutely junk. It took me weeks to put my files on there so I not only lost everything I put on there but I wasted a lot of my time. Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Huge but slow
customer_reviews.text: Giant space for a portable drive, but slow to track. It gets quicker if you are accessing the same parts of the drive over and over again. However, copying onto it (2tb) took the better part of a day. For regular daily use it isn't that bad. After you eject it the light stays on and sometimes if you pull the cord while the light is still on it will make a click sound which sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Harrison

customer_reviews.title: If you are going to move it around, you'll need to keep the cable handy
customer_reviews.text: USB 3.0 A to Micro B (Canvio end) cable included. Not every buyer will have a Micro B cable handy. I do and moving the Canvio from room to room was easy without hauling the cable along. I use the Canvio mostly from storing recorded TV programs. The USB 3 read/writes are quite speedy. I have not yet tried to use the included applications and have not had the drive long enough to attest to durability. I like the drive!
customer_reviews.author: Mens Sana

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely no installation...Toatal Satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift ( x2 ) for my two oldest boys. Their PS4 were the older 500GB version and as one might guess, they quickly ran out of space - having to delete some games to make room for others... and back and forth re-downloading and redeleting on and on. Dad (and Amazon) to the rescue. Adorable and portable with absolutely no installation. Truly plug-and-play. They even play games straight from this thing! Awesome. Total Satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: MacGuyverDad

customer_reviews.title: Most promising hard drive I've had
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this hard drive just for back up. Over the years, I've been through two other brands of external hard drives, both of which were difficult to use and stopped working without warning. So far this Toshiba is the easiest to install and use that I've had, it's small and compact. It can be left connected to the laptop, or disconnected and stored until next back up needed. I hope it proves durable, as I like it so far (a couple months in).
customer_reviews.author: Janice Stanger

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba Canvio Advance 2TB
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace a different brand which was just small to back up all of my data. The Toshiba is much smaller, but hold more than 2x the data. Looks sharp and was very easy to set up. Computer recognized it right away and then I backed up my computer. +++UPDATE+++ after 8 months, it has stopped working. Computer recognizes it, but cannot access it, while my other brand (even though its only 1 tera) it has worked for years. Going to look for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Steev
